conclusion: The resistance of R1 is 20Ω, and the internal resistance of the electric motor R2 is 10Ω.
When the switch is open, the ammeter reading is I0 = 0.5A.
When the switch is closed, the motor starts, and the voltage across the circuit remains unchanged.
The circuit diagram shows a switch, motor M, resistance R1, ammeter, and voltage U.
When the switch is open, the voltage across the circuit is U = I0 * R1 = 0.5A * 20Ω = 10V.
When the switch is closed, the total resistance of the circuit is R = R1 + R2 = 20Ω + 10Ω = 30Ω.
The current in the circuit when the switch is closed is I = U / R = 10V / 30Ω = 1/3 A.
The electric power consumed by the circuit is P = U * I = 10V * 1/3 A = 10/3 W ≈ 3.33W.
The electric power consumed by the circuit is less than 15W.
